courseInfo.prerequisite: Basic computer skills, including the ability to write basic statements and expressions.

rationale: Computer programming skills are now becoming part of basic education as these skills are increasing of vital importance for future job and career prospects. The Python programming language is one of the most popular programming languages worldwide. The course emphasizes the use of python programming in multiple domains. Python is a modern language for writing compact codes specifically for programming Server-side web apps, Data Analytics and Machine Learning, an important Artificial Intelligence domain. Furthermore, Python has gained popularity in scientific computing, production tools and game programming. This course focuses on developing python programming to do a variety of programming tasks where the students are encouraged to develop basic applications using different open source tools. At the end of the course, the student will be developing adequate basic programming skills using python language.

courseOutcomes.description: Prepare flowchart and algorithm for solving computing problems.
Develop python programs to solve simple problems.
Apply control structure feature of python for developing programs.
Develop programs in Python using built-in functions, modules, and library functions.
Develop python programs applying strings and lists manipulation concepts.

courseContent.unitTitle: Problem Solving using Flowchart and Algorithm
content: 1.1 Introduction, Steps for problem-solving, Algorithm and its characteristics, Importance of algorithm.
1.2 Symbolic representation of a flowchart, Importance and Limitations of flowchart, Flow of control
2.1 Introduction to python, Python features, Applications of python programming
2.3 Basic structure of python program, Python Comments, Keywords, identifiers, variables, Data types, and Operators.
• Mathematical Functions - abs(), divmod(), max(), min(), pow(), sum()
5.1 Introduction to Strings, String Operations, Traversing a String
5.3 Introduction to List and its Operations

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Prepare flowchart and algorithm for a given problem.
details: Find the sum of two given numbers.
Find a maximum out of two given numbers.
Find whether a given number is odd or even.
Find a maximum out of three given numbers.

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Install & configure python software and Create a program to print your name, date of birth and mobile number.
Develop a program to identify data-types in python.
Create programs for mathematical operations and conversions.
details: 1) Create a program to read three numbers from the user and find the average of the numbers.
2) Create a program to convert temperature from Fahrenheit to Celsius unit using eq: C=(F-32)/1.8

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Create programs for conditional statements and comparison operations.
details: 1) Create a program to identify whether the scanned number is even or odd and print an appropriate message.
2) Create a program to find a maximum number among the given three numbers.

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Develop a program to show whether the entered number is prime or not.
Develop a program to print odd and even numbers from 1 to N numbers. (Where N is an integer number entered by the user)
Develop a program to demonstrate the use of break, continue and pass statements.
Develop user-defined functions for mathematical operations.
details: 1) Develop a user-defined function to find the factorial of a given number.
2) Create a user-defined function to print the Fibonacci series of 0 to N numbers. (Where N is an integer number and passed as an argument)

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Write a program using the function that reverses the entered value.
Write a program that determines whether a given number is an Armstrong number or not using a user-defined function.
Write programs for string manipulation operations.
details: 1) Write a program to reverse words in a given sentence.
2) Write a program to check if a substring is present in a given string.
3) Write a program to count and display the number of vowels, consonants, uppercase, lowercase characters in a string.

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Create programs for list operations and analysis.
details: 1) Create a program to find the sum of all elements in a list using a loop.
2) Create a program to find the smallest and largest element in a given list.

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Given a list saved in variable: a = [1, 8, 7, 15, 25, 36, 48, 64, 81, 95]. Write a Python program that takes this list and makes a new list that has only the even elements of this list in it.

projectList.title: Number Systems Converter

projectList.title: Number System Table Generator
projectList.description: Print number system table for given range (Decimal | Binary | Octal | Hexadecimal)

projectList.title: Password Generator
projectList.description: Develop a program to generate random passwords (8 Digits).

projectGuidelines.overview: Only one project is planned to be undertaken by a student that needs to be assigned to him/her in the beginning of the semester. The project could be industry application based, internet-based, workshop-based, laboratory-based or field-based.
projectGuidelines.requirements: Each project should encompass two or more COs which are in fact, an integration of PrOs, UOs and ADOs.
projectGuidelines.documentation: Each student will have to maintain a dated work diary consisting of individual contributions in the project work and give a seminar presentation of it before submission.
projectGuidelines.duration: The duration of the project should be about 14-16 (fourteen to sixteen) student engagement hours during the course.
projectGuidelines.submission: The students ought to submit projects by the end of the semester to develop the industry-oriented COs.
projectGuidelines.customization: Similar projects could be added by the concerned course teacher.
